newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH FORESTRY APRIL OUTPUT UP 13.5 PCT YR/YR.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH FORESTRY APRIL OUTPUT UP 13.5 PCT YR/YR.

text.p: Finnish wood and paper industry output surged 13.5 percent year-on-year in April, and metal industry output rose 11 percent, Statistics Finland (SF) said in a statement on Monday.
It said total industrial output rose 7.9 percent year-on-year versus an 8.8 percent rise in March. The average of six forecasts was for a 9.2 percent growth rate in April.
"Metal industry ouput rose almost 11 percent and wood and paper industry output rose 13.5 percent from last April," SF said, adding these strong growth rates supported overall growth.
It said growth in electrotechnical equipment output was the strongest in the metal industry -- up 22.5 percent year-on-year.
"Pulp and paper output rose almost 14 percent," it said, adding this was partly due to the low level in April 1996.

Forest industry capacity utilisation was almost 95 percent in April, SF said. Metal industry capacity utilisation was over 91 percent, but the chemical industry used less than 80 percent of its capacity, it said. The overall rate was 89 percent.
